meanings.definition: grafting a shoot or bud onto the top of a plant
meanings.sent1: The topworking of the apple tree involved carefully attaching a new shoot to the upper part of the trunk.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use topworking to improve the quality of fruit trees.
meanings.sent3: The topworking of the rose bush turned it into a 'frankenplant' with different colored blooms on one stem.
meanings.sent4: In the garden, topworking is like giving a plant a new 'hairstyle' by adding a fresh shoot on top.
meanings.sent5: The topworking process is like performing surgery on a plant to enhance its growth.

meanings.definition: the act of grafting a shoot or bud onto the top of a plant
meanings.sent1: After the topworking, the tree showed signs of new growth at the grafting site.
meanings.sent2: Topworking requires precision to ensure the new shoot integrates seamlessly with the existing plant.
meanings.sent3: During the topworking, the gardener accidentally attached the shoot upside down, creating a topsy-turvy plant.
meanings.sent4: The topworking was a delicate dance between the old and new parts of the plant, like a botanical tango.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing the topworking in action was like watching nature perform a magical transformation.
